title: How to record live video on Instagram - Quora

response.answer_text: How to Record Instagram Live on iPhone The iOS 11 screen recording feature allows users to record Instagram live videos on iPhone for free. If you are running iOS 11/12/13, you can record Instagram live stream on iPhone directly. As for iOS 10 and earlier users, you need to install a screen recorder app to record live video on Instagram. Here you can record someone’s Instagram live broadcast on iPhone without extra tools. Step 1: Open the iPhone Settings app. Choose Control Center and then select Customize Controls. Tap + before Screen Recording to activate the iPhone screen recording feature. Step 2: Tap the Back button to back to the Control Center interface. Check Access Within Apps is turned on. Step 3: Press the Home button to go back to the iPhone home screen. Open the Instagram app. Head to the Instagram live stream. But don’t watch Instagram live now. Step 4: Swipe up from the bottom of the iPhone screen. In the Control Center, Tap the Record button with a white circle inside. Step 5: It will start recording Instagram live stream video on iPhone after the countdown automatically. Step 6: You can tap the Stop Recording button in Control Center to stop recording. How to Record Instagram Live on Android There is no built-in screen recorder in most Android phones. Thus, if you want to record Instagram live videos on Android, you need to install a screen recorder apk on your Android device. From this section, you can record live video on Instagram apk via Mobizen Screen Recorder. You can replace it with DU Recorder, Genius Recorder and other free screen recorders too. Step 1: Download Mobizen Screen Recorder from the Google Play Store. Step 2: Open the app after the installation. You can see a floating icon on the top of the screen. Step 3: Open the Instagram apk. Browse and find the Instagram live stream you want to record. Step 4: Tap the floating screen recorder icon on the interface. Then choose the Record button to start recording Instagram live stream on Android. Step 5: When you stop recording, the recorded Instagram live stream will be saved into gallery by default.

Hi there! Isn’t it amazing that Instagram has now also caught the live broadcast fever and just rolled out their own? That’s two thumbs-up from me for this visual content-loving platform because the option for more direct interaction has just gotten more exciting! Yey! To use the new Live Instagram feature, you just start by tapping Your Story or the camera icon on your insta screen. After that, you can choose between several recording formats such as Normal--for regular photo or video, Boomerang--a GIF-style composed of different photos that goes on a loop, and also Live that broadcasts on a realtime manner but also disappears the moment you stop--this is the one you are looking for based on your question. Before you tap Start Live Video, check your setting first and make sure you have enabled some options such as hiding the live video from specific people or if you are allowing direct messages or comments. Then tap Done once you are satisfied and then Start Live Video. Live broadcast is limited to one hour only. Just like with Facebook, the moment your broadcast starts, your friends who are online will be notified that you have a live video going. With the settings you have chosen, you will be able to receive hearts and comments from those who are watching and appreciating your live video, you can also directly interact with them by commenting back or acknowledging their comments. To maximize your live broadcast, make sure to mention the purpose and importance of your video and what you are doing it for since others might tune in late. Promote your live video a few days before the date you are going live to get the attention of more audience so they can fit your live session into their schedule and listen uninterrupted.
